Selected Answer: A
page 33, APO04, COBIT-2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY objective of implementing the process of managed innovation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Agility to turn business requirements into operational solutions
The correct answer is B. Option A is clearly Enterprise Goal and not Alignment Goal. Check Module/Chapter 4 Goals Cascade - Alignment Goals
CORRECT ANSWER IS B THE A IS A ENTERPRISE GOAL NO ALIGNMENT GOAL VIEW PAGE 31 AG06
CORRECT ANSWER IS B THE A IS A ENTERPRISE GOAL NO ALIGNMENT GOAL

Selected Answer: A
A. Compliance with external laws and regulations, Figure 4.18, COBIT-2019-Framework-Introduction-and-Methodology

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an alignment goal according to COBIT?

choices.A: Compliance with external laws and regulations
choices.B: Agility to turn business requirements into operational solutions

discussion.content:
Ans C is correct
EG05. customer-oriented service culture, Figure 4.17, Page 29,
COBIT 2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST describes the goal of having a customer-oriented service culture?

choices.A: Preparing key goal areas and metrics for each role
choices.C: Assigning levels of accountability and responsibility

questions.question_text: When tailoring the COBIT organizational structure, which of the following is the PRIMARY purpose for aligning role descriptions to the enterprise's business context, organization and operating environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Assigning levels of accountability and responsibility

choices.A: A governance system should be tailored to the enterprise's needs.
choices.B: A governance system should cover the enterprise end to end.
choices.C: A governance system should be dynamic.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A governance system should cover the enterprise end to end, focusing not only on the IT function but on all technology and information processing the enterprise puts in place to achieve its goals, regardless where the processing is located in the enterprise.
Reference:
https://www.futurelearn.com/info/courses/security-operations/0/steps/89307

Selected Answer: C
"A governance system should be dynamic. This means that each time one or more of the design factors are changed (e.g., a change in strategy or technology), the impact of these changes on the EGIT system must be considered." [Page #17 of Official Guide]

Selected Answer: C
This principle highlights the importance of having a governance system that can adapt and evolve in response to changes in technology, strategy, and the business environment. It emphasizes the need for continuous improvement and agility in governance processes to ensure that they remain effective and aligned with the organization's objectives.

Selected Answer: C
See Page 17, COBIT 2019 Framework Intro & Methodology
A governance system should be dynamic. This means that each time one or more of the design factors are
changed (e.g., a change in strategy or technology), the impact of these changes on the EGIT system must be
considered. A dynamic view of EGIT will lead toward a viable and future-proof EGIT system
C is the correct answer. Dynamic

Selected Answer: C
a doesn't make sense

The correct answer is "C" . Refer chapter 3 in the Into and methodology book as per below statement 
- 3. A governance system should be dynamic. This means that each time one or more of the design factors are
changed (e.g., a change in strategy or technology), the impact of these changes on the EGIT system must be considered. A dynamic view of EGIT will lead toward a viable and future-proof EGIT system.

questions.question_text: Which COBIT principle addresses the need to consider how many changes in technology or strategy impact the enterprise governance system as a whole?
